required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A 12-week Study of Pramipexole Extended Release (ER) in Patients With Parkinson's Disease (PD), Followed by a 52-week Long-term Treatment Period
clinical_study.official_title: A Double-blind, Double-dummy, Randomised, Parallel-group Study to Investigate the Safety, Tolerability, Trough Plasma Concentration, and Efficacy of Pramipexole ER Versus Pramipexole Immediate Release (IR) Administered Orally for 12 Weeks in Patients With Parkinson's Disease (PD) on L-dopa Therapy, Followed by a 52-week Open-label Long-term Treatment Period to Evaluate the Long-term Safety and Efficacy of Pramipexole ER

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this trial is to investigate the safety, tolerability, trough plasma concentration, and efficacy of pramipexole ER in comparison with those of pramipexole IR administrated orally for 12 weeks in patients with PD on levodopa (L-DOPA) therapy (the double-blind period). The double-blind period will be followed by the open-label 52 week administration of pramipexole ER to evaluate the long term safety and efficacy (the open-label period).

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Experienced Adverse Events
primary_outcome.description: An adverse event is defined as any untoward medical occurrence

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale (UPDRS) Parts II+III Total Score
secondary_outcome.description: UPDRS II+III ranging from 0 point(normal) to 160 point (severe). UPDRS part II measures activities of daily living, part III measures motor symptoms

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Percentage Off-time
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage off-time during waking hours in the last two days based on patient diary data, percentage ranging from 0 (best case) to 100 (worst case). Off-time describes a period when the patient experiences increased parkinsonian symptoms (e.g. immobility or inability to move with ease).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Percentage On-time Without Dyskinesia
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage on-time without dyskinesia during waking hours in the last two days based on patient diary data, percentage ranging from 0 (worst case) to 100 (best case). On-time describes a period when the patient has no symptoms of off-time and is not asleep.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Percentage On-time With Non-troublesome Dyskinesia
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage on-time with non-troublesome dyskinesia during waking hours in the last two days based on patient diary data, percentage ranging from 0(worst case) to 100 (best case). On-time describes a period when the patient has no symptoms of off-time and is not asleep.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Percentage On-time Without Dyskinesia or With Non-troublesome Dyskinesia
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage on-time without dyskinesia or non-troublesome dyskinesia during waking hours in the last two days based on patient diary data, percentage ranging from 0 (worst case) to 100 (best case). On-time describes a period when the patient has no symptoms of off-time and is not asleep.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Percentage On-time With Troublesome Dyskinesia
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage on-time with troublesome dyskinesia during waking hours in the last two days based on patient diary data, percentage ranging from 0 (best case) to 100 (worst case). On-time describes a period when the patient has no symptoms of off-time and is not asleep.

secondary_outcome.measure: Responder Rate For Clinical Global Impression of Improvement (CGI-I)
secondary_outcome.description: CGI-I scores ranging from '1' (very much improved) to '7' (very much worse), CGI-I responder have scoring of 1 or 2 (at least much improved)

secondary_outcome.measure: Responder Rate For Patient Global Impression of Improvement (PGI-I)
secondary_outcome.description: PGI-I scores ranging from '1' (very much better) to '7' (very much worse), PGI-I responder have scoring of 1 or 2 (at least much better)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in UPDRS Part I Score
secondary_outcome.description: UPDRS Part I ranging from 0 (normal) to 16 (severe). UPDRS Part I measures Mentation, Behavior and Mood

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in UPDRS Part II Score
secondary_outcome.description: UPDRS Part II ranging from 0 (normal) to 52 (severe). UPDRS Part II is calculated as the average of UPDRS Part II at on and UPDRS Part II at off-period for each of the 13 activities.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in UPDRS Part III Score
secondary_outcome.description: UPDRS Part III ranging from 0 (normal) to 108 (severe). UPDRS Part III measures motor symptoms

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in UPDRS Part IV Score
secondary_outcome.description: UPDRS Part IV ranging from 0 (normal) to 23 (severe). UPDRS Part IV measures complications of therapy

secondary_outcome.measure: UPDRS Parts II+III Total Score Responder Rate (at Least 20% Improvement)
secondary_outcome.description: Responders are defined as at least 20% decrease in the UPDRS Parts II+III Total Score ranges 0-160 scores from best to worse

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in L-dopa Daily Dose
secondary_outcome.description: The L-dopa daily dose was recorded in the electronic case report form (eCRF) at each trial visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Trough Plasma Concentration at Steady State
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at Visit 8 after pramipexole ER 4.5mg and IR 4.5mg treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Geometric mean (gMean) was calculated for trough plasma concentrations of pramipexole at steady state after administration of pramipexole IR 4.5mg and pramipexole ER 4.5mg.

secondary_outcome.measure: Dose Proportionality of Trough Plasma Concentration at Steady State After Pramipexole ER Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from Visit 1 to Visit 8 after pramipexole ER
secondary_outcome.description: Dose proportionality of trough plasma concentrations at steady state is explored by using the power model that described the functional relationship between the dose and plasma concentration

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From End of Double-Blind Period in UPDRS (Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale) Parts II+III Total Score (Open-label: Dose Adjustment Phase)
secondary_outcome.description: UPDRS II+III ranging from 0 point(normal) to 160 point (severe). UPDRS part II measures activities of daily living, part III measures motor symptoms. Least square means and standard errors presented are from ANCOVA with factors treatment and covariate baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients With no Worsening of UPDRS Parts II+III Total Score by More Than 15% From Week 12 to Week 16 (Open-label: Dose Adjustment Phase)
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients with no worsening of UPDRS Parts II+III Total Score by more than 15% from week 12 to week 16 (Open-label: Dose Adjustment Phase)

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Global Impression of Improvement (CGI-I) at Week 16 Compared to Patient's CGI-I Status at Week 12 (Open-label: Dose Adjustment Phase)
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical Global Impression of Improvement (CGI-I) at week 16 compared to patient's CGI-I status at week 12. CGI-I scores ranging from '1' (very much improved) to '7' (very much worse)

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient Global Impression of Improvement (PGI-I) at Week 16 Compared to Patient's PGI-I Status at Week 12 (Open-label: Dose Adjustment Phase)
secondary_outcome.description: Patient Global Impression of Improvement (PGI-I) at week 16 compared to patient's PGI-I status at week 12. PGI-I scores ranging from '1' (very much better) to '7' (very much worse).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in UPDRS (Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale) Parts II+III Total Score (Open-label: Maintenance Phase)
secondary_outcome.description: UPDRS II+III ranging from 0 point(normal) to 160 point (severe). UPDRS part II measures activities of daily living, part III measures motor symptoms

secondary_outcome.measure: UPDRS Parts II+III Total Score Responder Rate (at Least 20% Improvement) (Open-label: Maintenance Phase)
secondary_outcome.description: Responders are defined as at least 20% decrease in the UPDRS Parts II+III Total Score ranges 0-160 scores from best to worse

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Percentage Off-time (Open-label: Maintenance Phase)
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage off-time during waking hours in the last two days based on patient diary data, percentage ranging from 0 (best case) to 100 (worst case). Off-time describes a period when the patient experiences increased parkinsonian symptoms (e.g. immobility or inability to move with ease).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Percentage On-time Without Dyskinesia (Open-label: Maintenance Phase)
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage on-time without dyskinesia during waking hours in the last two days based on patient diary data, percentage ranging from 0 (worst case) to 100 (best case). On-time describes a period when the patient has no symptoms of off-time and is not asleep.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Percentage On-time With Non-troublesome Dyskinesia (Open-label Maintenance Phase)
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage on-time with non-troublesome dyskinesia during waking hours in the last two days based on patient diary data, percentage ranging from 0(worst case) to 100 (best case). On-time describes a period when the patient has no symptoms of off-time and is not asleep.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Percentage On-time Without Dyskinesia or With Non-troublesome Dyskinesia (Open-label Maintenance Phase)
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage on-time without dyskinesia or non-troublesome dyskinesia during waking hours in the last two days based on patient diary data, percentage ranging from 0 (worst case) to 100 (best case). On-time describes a period when the patient has no symptoms of off-time and is not asleep.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Percentage On-time With Troublesome Dyskinesia (Open-label Maintenance Phase)
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage on-time with troublesome dyskinesia during waking hours in the last two days based on patient diary data, percentage ranging from 0 (best case) to 100 (worst case). On-time describes a period when the patient has no symptoms of off-time and is not asleep.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in L-dopa Daily Dose (Open-label Maintenance Phase)
secondary_outcome.description: The L-dopa daily dose was recorded in the electronic case report form (eCRF) at each trial visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in UPDRS Part I Score (Open-label: Maintenance Phase)
secondary_outcome.description: UPDRS Part I ranging from 0 (normal) to 16 (severe). UPDRS Part I measures Mentation, Behavior and Mood

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in UPDRS Part II Score (Open-label: Maintenance Phase)
secondary_outcome.description: UPDRS Part II ranging from 0 (normal) to 52 (severe). UPDRS Part II is calculated as the average of UPDRS Part II at on and UPDRS Part II at off-period for each of the 13 activities.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in UPDRS Part III Score (Open-label: Maintenance Phase)
secondary_outcome.description: UPDRS Part III ranging from 0 (normal) to 108 (severe). UPDRS Part III measures motor symptoms

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in UPDRS Part IV Score (Open-label: Maintenance Phase)
secondary_outcome.description: UPDRS Part IV ranging from 0 (normal) to 23 (severe). UPDRS Part IV measures complications of therapy

arm_group.description: patient to receive a tablet containing 0.375 mg Pramipexole ER once a day plus containing 0.125 mg Pramipexole IR placebo twice a day -> a tablet containing 1.5 mg Pramipexole ER three times daily (TID) plus 0.5 mg Pramipexole IR placebo TID

patient to receive a tablet containing 0.125 mg Pramipexole IR twice a day plus containing 0.375 mg Pramipexole ER placebo once a day -> a tablet containing 0.5 mg Pramipexole IR three times daily (TID) plus 1.5 mg Pramipexole ER placebo TID

intervention.description: titrated as individually needed (0.25 mg - 4.5 mg daily)
titration as individually needed (0.375 mg -4.5 mg daily)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria
1. Male or female patients with diagnosis of PD including juvenile Parkinsonism, in whom the onset began at the age of forty or younger.
2. Patients with a modified Hoehn and Yahr scale of II to IV at "on" time.
3. Patients who have received an individual dosage of L-DOPA (either standard L-DOPA or L-DOPA with dopa-decarboxylase inhibitor) at a stable dose for at least 4 weeks before the baseline visit (Visit 2).
4. Patients who exhibit any therapeutically problematic issues or status based on L-DOPA therapy:
- wearing-off phenomena
- no on /delayed on
- dystonia at off time
- on-off phenomena
- freezing phenomena at off time
- the sub-optimal dose of L-DOPA had been administered due to side effects (such as dyskinesia), or therapeutical strategy
Exclusion criteria
1. Atypical parkinsonian syndromes due to drugs, metabolic disorders, encephalitis or degenerative diseases.
2. Dementia, as defined by a Mini-Mental State Examination (MMSE) score <24 at screening visit.
3. Any psychiatric disorder according to DSM-IV criteria that could prevent compliance or completion of the trial and/or put the patient at risk if he/she takes part in the trial.
4. History of psychosis, except history of drug induced hallucinations (provided the investigator considers that participation in the trial would not represent a significant risk for the patient).
5. Clinically significant ECG abnormalities at screening visit, according to investigator's judgement.
6. Clinically significant hypotension or symptomatic orthostatic hypotension (i.e., clinical symptoms of orthostatic hypotension such as dizziness postural etc associated with a decline >=20 mmHg in systolic blood pressure and a decline >=10 mmHg in diastolic blood pressure, at one minute after standing compared with the previous supine systolic and diastolic blood pressure obtained after 5 minutes of quiet rest) either at screening visit or at baseline visit.
7. Any other clinically significant disease, whether treated or not, that could put the patient at risk or could prevent compliance or completion of the trial.
8. Pregnancy (to be excluded by serum pregnancy test at screening visit) or breast-feeding.
9. Sexually active female of childbearing potential not using a medically approved method of birth control within one month before to the screening visit and throughout the trial period.
10. Serum levels of AST, ALT, alkaline phosphatases or bilirubin >2 upper limits of normal .
11. Patients with a creatinine clearance <50 mL/min
12. Patients with a complication or signs of malignant tumours or those within 5 years after the treatment.

group.title: Pramipexole Extended Release Group (PPX ER)
group.description: Pramipexole ER (tablets of 0.375 mg and 1.5 mg) dose: 0.375 mg, 0.75 mg, 1.5 mg, 2.25 mg, 3.0 mg, 3.75 mg, or 4.5 mg, once a day

group.title: Pramipexole Immediate Release Group (PPX IR)
group.description: Pramipexole Immediate Release (IR) tablets of 0.125 mg and 0.5 mg dose: 0.25 mg, 0.5 mg, 1.0 mg, 1.5 mg, 2.0 mg, 2.5 mg, 3.0 mg, 3.5 mg, or 4.5 mg, twice or three times a day

participants_list.participants: all patients received Pramipexole ER for the 52-week open-label period
all patients received Pramipexole ER for the 52-week open-label period

measure.title: Change From Baseline in UPDRS Part II Score
measure.description: UPDRS Part II ranging from 0 (normal) to 52 (severe). UPDRS Part II is calculated as the average of UPDRS Part II at on and UPDRS Part II at off-period for each of the 13 activities.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS) with last observation carried forward (LOCF)

outcome.description: UPDRS Part III ranging from 0 (normal) to 108 (severe). UPDRS Part III measures motor symptoms

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Who Experienced Adverse Events
outcome.description: An adverse event is defined as any untoward medical occurrence
outcome.population: Treated set for safety, which was the analysis set including all the patients who had valid measurements after drug administration.

group.title: Pramipexole Extended Release Group (PPX ER)
group.description: Pramipexole ER (tablets of 0.375 mg and 1.5 mg) dose: 0.375 mg, 0.75 mg, 1.5 mg, 2.25 mg, 3.0 mg, 3.75 mg, or 4.5 mg, once a day

measure.population: Treated set for safety, which was the analysis set including all the patients who had valid measurements after drug administration.

outcome.title: Trough Plasma Concentration at Steady State
outcome.description: Geometric mean (gMean) was calculated for trough plasma concentrations of pramipexole at steady state after administration of pramipexole IR 4.5mg and pramipexole ER 4.5mg.
outcome.time_frame: at Visit 8 after pramipexole ER 4.5mg and IR 4.5mg treatment
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS)

group.title: Pramipexole Extended Release Group (PPX ER)
group.description: Pramipexole ER (tablets of 0.375 mg and 1.5 mg) dose: 0.375 mg, 0.75 mg, 1.5 mg, 2.25 mg, 3.0 mg, 3.75 mg, or 4.5 mg, once a day

group.title: Pramipexole Immediate Release Group (PPX IR)
group.description: Pramipexole IR (tablets of 0.125 mg and 0.5 mg) dose: 0.25 mg, 0.5 mg, 1.0 mg, 1.5 mg, 2.0 mg, 2.5 mg, 3.0 mg, 3.5 mg, or 4.5 mg, twice or three times a day

measure.title: Trough Plasma Concentration at Steady State
measure.description: Geometric mean (gMean) was calculated for trough plasma concentrations of pramipexole at steady state after administration of pramipexole IR 4.5mg and pramipexole ER 4.5mg.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS)

outcome.title: Dose Proportionality of Trough Plasma Concentration at Steady State After Pramipexole ER Treatment
outcome.description: Dose proportionality of trough plasma concentrations at steady state is explored by using the power model that described the functional relationship between the dose and plasma concentration
outcome.time_frame: from Visit 1 to Visit 8 after pramipexole ER
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS).

group.title: Pramipexole Extended Release Group (PPX ER)
group.description: Pramipexole ER (tablets of 0.375 mg and 1.5 mg) dose: 0.375 mg, 0.75 mg, 1.5 mg, 2.25 mg, 3.0 mg, 3.75 mg, or 4.5 mg, once a day

measure.title: Dose Proportionality of Trough Plasma Concentration at Steady State After Pramipexole ER Treatment
measure.description: Dose proportionality of trough plasma concentrations at steady state is explored by using the power model that described the functional relationship between the dose and plasma concentration
measure.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS).

outcome.title: Change From End of Double-Blind Period in UPDRS (Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale) Parts II+III Total Score (Open-label: Dose Adjustment Phase)
outcome.description: UPDRS II+III ranging from 0 point(normal) to 160 point (severe). UPDRS part II measures activities of daily living, part III measures motor symptoms. Least square means and standard errors presented are from ANCOVA with factors treatment and covariate baseline.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS 2) for open label period with observed case (OC)

group.title: From PPX ER to PPX ER
group.description: Pramipexole ER (tablets of 0.375 mg and 1.5 mg) dose: 0.375 mg, 0.75 mg, 1.5 mg, 2.25 mg, 3.0 mg, 3.75 mg, or 4.5 mg, once a day

group.title: From PPX IR to PPX ER

measure.title: Change From End of Double-Blind Period in UPDRS (Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale) Parts II+III Total Score (Open-label: Dose Adjustment Phase)
measure.description: UPDRS II+III ranging from 0 point(normal) to 160 point (severe). UPDRS part II measures activities of daily living, part III measures motor symptoms. Least square means and standard errors presented are from ANCOVA with factors treatment and covariate baseline.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS 2) for open label period with observed case (OC)

outcome.description: Percentage of patients with no worsening of UPDRS Parts II+III Total Score by more than 15% from week 12 to week 16 (Open-label: Dose Adjustment Phase)
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS 2) for the open-label period

measure.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS 2) for open label period with observed case (OC)

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Percentage Off-time (Open-label: Maintenance Phase)
outcome.description: Percentage off-time during waking hours in the last two days based on patient diary data, percentage ranging from 0 (best case) to 100 (worst case). Off-time describes a period when the patient experiences increased parkinsonian symptoms (e.g. immobility or inability to move with ease).
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS 2) for open label period with observed case (OC)

group.title: Pramipexole ER: Open-Label Phase
group.description: Pramipexole ER (tablets of 0.375 mg and 1.5 mg) dose: 0.375 mg, 0.75 mg, 1.5 mg, 2.25 mg, 3.0 mg, 3.75 mg, or 4.5 mg, once a day during open-label period

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Percentage Off-time (Open-label: Maintenance Phase)
measure.description: Percentage off-time during waking hours in the last two days based on patient diary data, percentage ranging from 0 (best case) to 100 (worst case). Off-time describes a period when the patient experiences increased parkinsonian symptoms (e.g. immobility or inability to move with ease).
measure.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS 2) for open label period with observed case (OC)

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Percentage On-time Without Dyskinesia (Open-label: Maintenance Phase)
outcome.description: Percentage on-time without dyskinesia during waking hours in the last two days based on patient diary data, percentage ranging from 0 (worst case) to 100 (best case). On-time describes a period when the patient has no symptoms of off-time and is not asleep.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS 2) for open label period with observed case (OC)

group.title: Pramipexole ER: Open-Label Phase
group.description: Pramipexole ER (tablets of 0.375 mg and 1.5 mg) dose: 0.375 mg, 0.75 mg, 1.5 mg, 2.25 mg, 3.0 mg, 3.75 mg, or 4.5 mg, once a day during open-label period

measure.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS 2) for open label period with observed case (OC)

reported_events.time_frame: From the first dose of trial medication onwards through the observational phase (64 weeks).

group.title: Pramipexole Extended Release Group (PPX ER)
group.description: Pramipexole ER (tablets of 0.375 mg and 1.5 mg) dose: 0.375 mg, 0.75 mg, 1.5 mg, 2.25 mg, 3.0 mg, 3.75 mg, or 4.5 mg, once a day

group.title: Pramipexole Immediate Release Group (PPX IR)
group.description: Pramipexole IR (tablets of 0.125 mg and 0.5 mg) dose: 0.25 mg, 0.5 mg, 1.0 mg, 1.5 mg, 2.0 mg, 2.5 mg, 3.0 mg, 3.5 mg, or 4.5 mg, twice or three times a day

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Any publication of the result of this trial must be consistent with the Boehringer Ingelheim publication policy. The rights of the investigator and of the sponsor with regard to publication of the results of this trial are described in the investigator contract.
